DOC.brief_summary: Eight patients with corneal neovascularization were treated with subconjunctival injection of 1.25 mg bevacizumab and had a follow-up of at least 2 months. All patients had persistent corneal neovascularization for at least 6 months unresponsive to other treatments. Patients were monitored by ophthalmic exam and anterior segment photography.
DOC.brief_title: The Effect of Bevacizumab on Corneal Neovascularization
DOC.detailed_description: To evaluate the effect of repeated subconjunctival bevacizumab (AvastinÂ®, Roche, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil) on inflammatory corneal neovascularization. Eight patients with corneal neovascularization were treated with subconjunctival injection of 1.25 mg bevacizumab and had a follow-up of at least 2 months. All patients had persistent corneal neovascularization for at least 6 months unresponsive to other treatments. Patients were monitored by ophthalmic exam and anterior segment photography.
